name: RunNunitWithOpenCover
description: Runs Nunit tests using OpenCover command line and nunit3 consolen runner to generate coverage report.
author: RKOS

inputs.name: testassembly
inputs.label: Testassembly
inputs.helpMarkDown: specifieys dlls to be run by nunit console runnner.

inputs.name: registerOption
inputs.label: Register Option
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the -register Option for OpenCover call.

options.Path32: 'Path32' uses local 32bit version of opencover service dll without registry.
options.Path64: 'Path64'uses local 64bit version of opencover service dll without registry.
options.User: 'User' registers the service dll(s) for running User Acount (BuildAgent User).

inputs.name: coverageFilter
inputs.label: Coverage Filter
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the Domain/Classes to be analyzed with Coverage Data (e.g.:'+[MyNamespace]*').

inputs.name: generateReport
inputs.label: Generate Report
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, the Coverage result is used to generate HTML Report as Build Artefact.

inputs.name: tfsUser
inputs.label: TFS User
inputs.helpMarkDown: An User Account with access rights to TFS REST API is needed.

inputs.name: tfsPwd
inputs.label: TFS USers Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Passsword for the TFS User. Its better to keep default value here and enter the 'TfsSecretPassword' as hidden variable in the Build Variables Section.
